abstract_summ: The recent coronavirus pandemic follows in its early stages an almost exponential growth, with the number of cases quite well fit in time by $N(t)\propto e^{\alpha t}$, in many countries.We analyze the rate α in different countries, choosing as a starting point in each country the first day with 30 cases and fitting for the following 12 days, capturing thus the early exponential growth in a rather homogeneous way.Our findings give hope that, for northern hemisphere countries, the growth rate should significantly decrease as a result of both warmer weather and lockdown policies.Our findings give hope that, for northern hemisphere countries, the growth rate should significantly decrease as a result of both warmer weather and lockdown policies.However, this assumption leads to exponential growth, and while the growth rate is high, it is not following exponential behavior.
title_summ: Nature of transmission of Covid19 in IndiaFractal kinetics of COVID-19 pandemicAn Epidemic Model SIPHERD and its application for prediction of the spread of COVID-19 infection in IndiaPoorly known aspects of flattening the curve of COVID-19Universality in COVID-19 spread in view of the Gompertz functionTemperature dependence of COVID-19 transmissionPiecewise quadratic growth during the 2019 novel coronavirus epidemicOn the Emergence of a Power Law in the Distribution of COVID-19 CasesTemperature dependence of COVID-19 transmissionPower-law distribution in the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases
